sentence.Network_en: He disingenuously remarked that he knew nothing about strategy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他假惺惺地称自己对战术一窍不通。

sentence.Network_en: Then, after telling the deputation to rise she continued, graciously and effectively , if disingenuously.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着, 她让跪着的代表团起来, 以不那么诚恳,却是谦和,颇能打动人心的语气继续说道.

sentence.Network_en: Disingenuously, he asked leading questions abut his opponent's work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他狡猾地问了一些有关他对手工作的关键性问题.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... disingenuous 无诚意的 disingenuously 不诚实地 disinherit 剥夺继承权.
近似字词-新浪字典 ... disinformation 故意的假情报 disingenuously 不老实地 disinherit 剥夺继承权;废嫡.

list.abs: More than that he seems disingenuous ; in fact , his smile looks phony too ., 更有甚者 , 他似乎并无诚意 , 事实上 , 他的笑容也显得虚伪.
disingenuouslydisingenuousness disinherit 失继承权disinheritance disintegrate 分解分裂分化瓦解破裂崩溃粉碎分.
To attribute that entirely to Mr Obama would be disingenuous ., 把这完全归咎于奥巴马是不诚实的.
Hence the disingenuous compromise of " truth within a relevant discipline " ., 因此 , 对 " 相关学科真理 " 的虚伪妥协也是如此.

entry.tran: 不诚恳的;不坦率的;狡猾的
entry.def: Someone who is disingenuous is slightly dishonest and insincere in what they say.

example.ex: It would be disingenuous to claim that this is great art.
example.tran: 称这是艺术瑰宝是言不由衷。

sentences.sentence: "disingenuously, he asked leading questions abut his opponent's work"

auth_sentence.content: When I asked Dhafer if he was the real leader of the city, he smiled disingenuously.
